required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Estimate the Behavior of Chinese Anesthesiologists Practicing General Anesthesia With Sevoflurane
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center Registry to Estimate the Behavior of Chinese Anesthesiologists Practicing General Anesthesia With Sevoflurane

collaborator.agency: Rundo-Cronova International Pharmaceuticals Research & Development Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: This registry is primarily aiming to demonstrate the correlation between good practices of anesthesiologists and patient related outcomes including decreased overall anesthesia cost. The investigators would also like to demonstrate how the training background, and experience in inhalational anesthesia of the anesthesiologist influence their daily practice. At the end of the registry, the investigators would be able to demonstrate the influence of different practice pattern on patient related outcomes between the sites at which anesthesiologists follow modern anesthesiology practice based on their training/experience background and at which anesthesiologists do not follow same type of practice due to lack of their inhalational anesthesia training/experience.

primary_outcome.measure: Anesthesiologist Satisfaction With the Anesthesia Recorded at the End of the Operation Using a Numeric Analog Scale (NAS)
primary_outcome.description: Anesthesiologist satisfaction with the anesthesia administered to each patient during surgery was recorded at the end of the operation using a Numeric Analog Scale (NAS) from 0 (not satisfied at all) to 10 (completely satisfied) are summarized.

primary_outcome.measure: Patient Satisfaction With the Anesthesia Recorded at the End of the Operation Using a Numeric Analog Scale (NAS)
primary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction with the anesthesia recorded at the end of the operation within 24 hours using a numeric analog scale (NAS) from 0 (not satisfied at all) to 10 (completely satisfied) are summarized.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Loss of Consciousness of Patients Administered Anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: The time to loss of consciousness was measured from commencement of administration of anesthesia to the patient's loss of consciousness (no response to command).
The time to intubation of the patients was measured from the commencement of administration of anesthesia to intubation of each patient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Eye Opening of Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every minute after cessation of anesthesia until the patient opened his/her eyes
secondary_outcome.description: Time to eye opening of patients was measured by the time from cessation of anesthesia administration to opening of the patients' eyes. After cessation of anesthesia, the investigators lightly tapped on the patients forehead or shoulder and asked the patients to open their eyes. This process was repeated about every minute until the patients opened their eyes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every minute after cessation of anesthesia until the patient was extubated
secondary_outcome.description: The time to extubation of patients was measured from cessation of anesthesia administration to tracheal extubation of the patient.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Chinese Patients Requiring Surgery with Anesthesia
arm_group.description: Chinese patients 18 to 70 years of age, meeting the American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Physical Status Class 1 (normal healthy), Class 2 (mild systemic disease), or Class 3 (severe systemic disease), who underwent surgery requiring general anesthesia (sevoflurane) administered per local Prescribing Information and endotracheal intubation or laryngeal mask airway (LMA).

study_pop.textblock: Chinese patients undergoing surgery requiring general anesthesia with endotracheal intubation or laryngeal mask airway

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. ASA (American Society of Anesthesiologists) physical status (a requirement of the patient's physical status): I to III
2. Age from 18 to 70 years
3. Surgery requiring general anesthesia with endotracheal intubation or laryngeal mask airway.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of significant cardiovascular, pulmonary, renal, hepatic or central nervous system disease or muscle disease.
2. Hypersensitivity or unusual response to any halogenated anesthetics.
3. Personal or familial history of malignant hyperthermia.
4. Female patients either pregnant or breast feeding.
5. General anesthesia is administered with total intravenous anesthesia (TIVA) of propofol.

group.title: Chinese Patients Requiring Surgery With Anesthesia
group.description: Chinese patients 18 to 70 years of age, meeting the American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Physical Status Class 1 (normal healthy), Class 2 (mild systemic disease), or Class 3 (severe systemic disease), who underwent surgery requiring general anesthesia administered per the local Prescribing Information and endotracheal intubation or laryngeal mask airway (LMA). Note, 3 patients were excluded from all analyses who did not meet ASA Physical Status Class 1 through 3.

participants_list.participants: 3 patients who did not meet ASA Physical Status Class 1 - 3 were excluded from all analyses.

group.title: Chinese Patients Requiring Surgery With Anesthesia
group.description: Chinese patients 18 to 70 years of age, meeting the American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Physical Status Class 1 (normal healthy), Class 2 (mild systemic disease), or Class 3 (severe systemic disease), who underwent surgery requiring general anesthesia administered per the local Prescribing Information and endotracheal intubation or laryngeal mask airway (LMA). Note, 3 patients were excluded from all analyses who did not meet ASA Physical Status Class 1 through 3.

outcome.title: Anesthesiologist Satisfaction With the Anesthesia Recorded at the End of the Operation Using a Numeric Analog Scale (NAS)
outcome.description: Anesthesiologist satisfaction with the anesthesia administered to each patient during surgery was recorded at the end of the operation using a Numeric Analog Scale (NAS) from 0 (not satisfied at all) to 10 (completely satisfied) are summarized.
outcome.population: 400 participating anesthesiologists evaluated their satisfaction with anesthesia (sevoflurane) administered to patients during surgery. All available data for 3,993 patients are included and summarized.

group.title: Chinese Patients Requiring Surgery With Anesthesia

outcome.description: Patient satisfaction with the anesthesia recorded at the end of the operation within 24 hours using a numeric analog scale (NAS) from 0 (not satisfied at all) to 10 (completely satisfied) are summarized.
outcome.population: All available data were included in the analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: All adverse events experienced by patients that occurred during the course of the study were reported. Adverse events occurring during the study were reported up to 30 days after the last dose of study treatment.

group.title: Chinese Patients Requiring Surgery With Anesthesia
group.description: Chinese patients 18 to 70 years of age, meeting the American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Physical Status Class 1 (normal healthy), Class 2 (mild systemic disease), or Class 3 (severe systemic disease), who underwent surgery requiring general anesthesia administered per the local Prescribing Information and endotracheal intubation or laryngeal mask airway (LMA). Note, 3 patients were excluded from all analyses who did not meet ASA Physical Status Class 1 through 3.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Abbott requests that any investigator or institution that plans on presenting/publishing results disclosure, provide written notification of their request 60 days prior to their presentation/publication. Abbott requests that no presentation/publication will be instituted until 12 months after a study is completed, or after the first presentation/publication whichever occurs first. A delay may be proposed of a presentation/publication if Abbott needs to secure patent or proprietary protection.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Types of surgery not restricted/stratified in the study and no standard practice in China on inhalation and intravenous anesthesia methods may skew/bias results. Gaps in study design and multiple outcome parameters make drawing conclusions difficult.
